Inferiority Complex is a psychological condition in which a person experiences a sense of inferiority or a lack of confidence in his or her abilities or self-worth. This condition can be caused by a number of factors, including negative experiences, low self-esteem, and a lack of confidence in one's abilities. Inferiority Complex can lead to a variety of psychological problems, such as depression, anxiety, and low self-esteem.

In order to overcome an inferiority complex, it is important to identify the cause and develop strategies to improve self-confidence and self-esteem. This may include seeking professional help from a psychologist or counselor, practicing positive thinking and self-affirmation, and setting realistic goals and achieving them. It is also important to surround oneself with supportive people and environments that can help build confidence and increase self-worth.

There is currently no specific treatment for COVID-19 but there are medications that can help relieve symptoms such as fever and shortness of breath while your body fights off the virus on its own. If you have a severe case of COVID-19 you may need to be hospitalized where you will receive oxygen therapy or other treatments specific to your condition. There is currently no vaccine against COVID-19 so it is important that we all follow guidelines to prevent the spread of the virus until we have a safe and effective vaccine available for everyone worldwide.

Jal Suraksha (Water Safety)

Jal Suraksha (Water Safety) refers to the protection and preservation of water resources from contamination and damage. It includes measures such as wastewater treatment, drinking water quality control, and flood control.

Environmental Protection

Environmental Protection (EP) refers to the activities aimed at protecting the natural environment and minimizing its degradation. This includes actions such as preserving biodiversity, managing air and water pollution, reducing waste generation, and controlling greenhouse gas emissions.

Global Warming

Global Warming refers to the rise in average temperatures on Earth's surface due to increasing concentrations of greenhouse gases in the atmosphere. This is a serious environmental issue that requires immediate action to prevent further damage.

Energy Conservation

Energy Conservation refers to the reduction of energy consumption through efficient use of energy resources. This includes measures such as reducing energy waste, improving energy efficiency, and using renewable energy sources.

Ecology

Ecology refers to the study of interactions between organisms and their environment. It encompasses a wide range of disciplines including biology, environmental science, and conservation biology.

Renewable Energy Sources (RES)

Renewable Energy Sources (RES) are energy sources that can be replenished naturally over time such as solar, wind, hydroelectricity, biomass, and geothermal energy. These sources are becoming increasingly important as the world strives to reduce dependence on fossil fuels.

1. Social distancing: It means maintaining physical distance between you and people around you. For example, you can maintain at least six feet (2 meters) of distance from other people.

2. Face mask: You should wear a face mask or face covering when you are around people outside your household, especially in public places where you may come in close contact with other people, such as grocery stores, pharmacies, and public transportation.

3. Frequent hand washing: You should wash your hands frequently with soap and water for at least 20 seconds, especially after coming in close contact with other people or before handling food. If soap and water are not available, you can use an alcohol-based hand sanitizer that contains at least 60% alcohol.

4. Disinfecting surfaces: You should regularly clean and disinfect frequently touched surfaces in your home, work environment, or public areas. This includes tables, doorknobs, light switches, countertops, handles, desks, toilets, faucets, and sinks.

5. Quarantine: If you have been exposed to someone with COVID-19 or have symptoms of COVID-19 yourself, you should stay home until your symptoms improve and get tested for COVID-19. If the test result is negative for COVID-19, you can end quarantine after 10 days since the last exposure.

prompt: ### Human: "क्या कतार एक ADT है या डेटा संरचना?"### Assistant:
system:
अब कैसे होती है एक ADT है तथा डेटा संरचना? व्यवस्था: "ADT" (Advanced Direct Torque) में "ADT" एक व्यवस्थ पर्योगी, "Direct Torque Control" एक "Direct Torque Control" में "DTC" नि: https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Direct_Torque_Control

ADT: Advanced Direct Torque, commonly referred to as ADT or just "Direct Torque", is a type of motor controller that allows a motor to control its torque output by directly measuring the voltage and current of the motor. It is often used in electric vehicles and hybrid electric vehicles to provide regenerative braking and power control. ADT is a type of variable reluctance motor controller that uses a series of magnets to create a rotating magnetic field around the rotor of the motor. The controller uses the rotor position to measure the speed and direction of the motor, and adjusts the voltage and current of the motor to achieve the desired torque output. ADT is a type of variable reluctance motor controller that allows the motor to control its own torque output.

DTC: Direct Torque Control, commonly referred to as DTC or just "Torque Control", is a type of electric vehicle powertrain control system that uses a series of sensors to measure the rotational speed and torque output of the motor. The controller uses this information to control the amount of current being supplied to the motor, which in turn controls the amount of torque being produced. DTC allows for more precise control over the torque produced by an electric vehicle, which can improve efficiency and performance.

So, as you can see, ADT and DTC are two different types of electric vehicle powertrain control systems that use different methods to control the torque output of an electric vehicle's motor. DTC uses sensors and electronic controllers to measure and control the torque output, while ADT uses magnets and motors to directly measure the speed and direction of the rotor to adjust voltage and current accordingly. Both systems have their advantages and disadvantages, but ultimately it comes down to personal preference and what type of system is most suitable for a specific application or use case.
source: "क्या कतार एक ADT है या डेटा संरचना?"

Cura-3D, an open source software program, is a printer management software that allows you to control and manage the settings for your 3D printer. It has a user-friendly interface and can be used by both beginners and advanced users. It is compatible with a wide range of 3D printers, including desktop, FDM, and SLA/SLS printers. Cura-3D is available for download from its website.

You can use Cura-3D to prepare your 3D model for printing, adjust the settings for different materials and printer types, and generate a print file that can be sent to your 3D printer. You can also use the software to monitor the progress of your print job, and analyze the performance of your printer.

To use Cura-3D, you will need to have a 3D printer that is connected to your computer, as well as a computer with internet access. Once you have set up your printer and connected it to your computer, you can start using Cura-3D.

The first step is to prepare the 3D model for printing. You can use any modeling software to create the model, or you can download a pre-made model from the internet. Once you have created or downloaded the model, you need to import it into Cura-3D. You can do this by clicking on the Import button in the toolbar or by going to File -> Import from File in the menu bar.

Once the model has been imported into Cura-3D, you can start adjusting the settings for different materials and printer types. This includes adjusting the print speed, temperature settings, infill density, and other parameters that affect the quality of your print. You can also select different print settings based on the material type and printer type. For example, if you are printing with PLA filament on an FDM printer, you may want to select different settings than if you are printing with ABS filament on an SLS printer.

After adjusting the settings for your 3D model, you can generate a print file that can be sent to your 3D printer. The file format will depend on your printer type and model. For example, if you are using an FDM printer, you will need to generate an STL file that contains information about the object to be printed in three dimensions. If you are using an SLS or other type of SLA/SLS printer, you will need to generate an OBJ file that contains information about how the object will be sliced into layers for printing. You can then send this file to your 3D printer through a USB cable or network connection."

AI: Artificial Intelligence is a field of computer science that focuses on developing smart machines capable of intelligent behaviour. The term AI was first coined by John McCarthy in the late 1950s. Since then, the field has grown significantly, and today AI is used in a wide range of applications, from speech recognition and natural language processing to self-driving cars and medical diagnostics.

Deep Learning: Deep learning is a subset of machine learning that uses neural networks inspired by the structure and function of the human brain. Unlike traditional machine learning algorithms, which operate on a single layer of neurons, deep learning algorithms use multiple layers of neurons to model complex relationships and patterns in data. This allows them to learn more abstract representations of data and make more accurate predictions.

Artificial Neural Network: An artificial neural network is a computer model that mimics the structure and function of the human brain. It consists of interconnected nodes, or neurons, that are arranged in layers, similar to how neurons are organized in the brain. The input layer receives information from external sensors or sources, the hidden layer contains the neurons that perform processing and make decisions, and the output layer outputs the result of the processing. Artificial neural networks are widely used in areas such as computer vision, speech recognition, natural language processing, and machine learning.

Machine Learning Algorithm: A machine learning algorithm is a set of rules or instructions that tell a computer how to process data and make predictions or decisions based on that data. Machine learning algorithms are used in a wide range of applications, from image recognition to fraud detection. They can be divided into two main categories: supervised learning and unsupervised learning. In supervised learning, a computer is given labeled training data consisting of input variables and their corresponding target outputs. The goal is to find a function that can accurately predict the target output from input variables. In unsupervised learning, a computer is given unlabeled data without any input variables or target outputs. The goal is to find patterns or structures in the data that can be used to group similar inputs together or identify outliers.

Deep Neural Network Algorithm: A deep neural network algorithm is a specific type of machine learning algorithm that uses deep learning techniques such as convolutional neural networks, recurrent neural networks, and generative adversarial networks. These algorithms are designed to model complex relationships between data points using multiple layers of neurons, enabling them to learn more abstract representations of data and make more accurate predictions. Deep neural networks are widely used in areas such as image recognition, natural language processing, and time series forecasting.

AI vs DNN vs DLA vs DNNAL: AI refers to the overall field of research on developing smart machines capable of intelligent behaviour while Deep Neural Networks refers to an approach within AI for building these systems through artificial neural networks consisting of multiple layers with nonlinear transformations between layers and DNN refers to any type of deep neural network algorithm regardless of whether it is developed specifically for AI research or not while DLA refers to any type of deep learning algorithm developed specifically for AI research while DNNAL refers to any type of deep neural network algorithm developed specifically for AI research regardless whether it is developed for AI research or not
source: "माइक और जो ऐतिहासिक रूप से सबसे महान एजाइल कोच बनने के लिए AI की शक्ति का उपयोग करके करोड़पति बनने के बारे में एक कविता लिखें। एजाइल मंफेस्टो से सामग्री शामिल करें।"

prompt: ### Human: "2022 में ESG से संबंधित महत्वपूर्ण घटनाओं का एक क्रमबद्ध विवरण लिखें।"### Assistant:
system:
"आज हम एक क्रमबद्ध विवरण लिखें। "ESG" की प्रयोग से में "Environmental", "Social", "Governance" से ही रोजगार, "Ethical", "Social", "Governance" नाम पर्योगश्रेष्ठ है, और शर्त व्रोम पर्योग.

ESG-Rating agencies, also known as ESG-Rating Agencies or ESG-Ratings agencies, are companies that rate the ESG performance of companies based on a set of metrics, such as their environmental, social and governance practices. These ratings are used by investors and other stakeholders to assess the sustainability of a company's business practices.

ESG-Rating agencies use a variety of metrics to rate companies' ESG performance, including their:
Environmental performance: This includes metrics such as energy use, greenhouse gas emissions, water usage and waste production.
Social performance: This includes metrics such as workplace diversity and inclusion, employee well-being and human rights.
Governance performance: This includes metrics such as board diversity, executive compensation, corporate governance and transparency.

ESG-Rating agencies also take into account the broader context in which a company operates, such as its sector, geographic region and regulatory environment.

In conclusion, ESG-Rating agencies provide a valuable service to investors and other stakeholders by providing an objective assessment of a company's ESG performance. By using a consistent set of metrics and criteria, ESG-Rating agencies can help to standardize ESG assessments and provide transparency for investors and other stakeholders."
source: "2022 में ESG से संबंधित महत्वपूर्ण घटनाओं का एक क्रमबद्ध विवरण लिखें।"

prompt: ### Human: "लॉटाडिजिटल.कॉम का एक्जीक्यूटिव सारांश मुझे दें"### Assistant:
system:
लॉटाडिजिटल.कॉम का एक्जीक्यूटिव सारांश मुझे दें, हर से से लॉट लॉटे मेरे प्रोफ्स स्रो ब्र्रैन् दर्श.

1. **Low-code, no-code, or citizen developer tools?**: Low-code, no-code, and citizen developer tools are all software that enables the creation of applications without the need for extensive coding knowledge. However, each tool has its own unique features and capabilities that make it suitable for different use cases.

Low-code tools, such as Microsoft Power Apps and Salesforce Lightning Flow, provide an intuitive user interface that allows users to build applications using pre-built components and templates. These tools are ideal for businesses that need to quickly create simple applications without the need for extensive coding knowledge.

No-code tools, such as Google Sheets and Microsoft Excel, allow users to create applications without writing code. These tools are ideal for businesses that want to create basic applications but do not have the time or resources to learn how to code.

Citizen developer tools, such as Microsoft Power Automate and Zapier, provide a platform for users to create applications using pre-built connectors and templates. These tools are ideal for businesses that want to empower their employees to create their own applications without the need for extensive coding knowledge.

2. **Benefits of low-code, no-code, or citizen developer tools?**: Low-code, no-code, and citizen developer tools can offer a variety of benefits to businesses, including:

Time savings: Low-code and no-code tools allow users to quickly build applications without the need for extensive coding knowledge, which can save time and resources on development projects.

Faster time to market: With low-code or no-code tools, businesses can quickly create applications that can be deployed quickly in the market, enabling them to respond more quickly to changing market conditions and customer needs.

Lower costs: Low-code and no-code tools require less time and resources than traditional coding methods, making them more cost effective for businesses with limited development resources.

Increased productivity: Low-code and no-code tools can enable employees with limited coding skills to build applications that can help improve business productivity.

3. **Limitations of low-code, no-code, or citizen developer tools?**: Despite the benefits of low-code, no-code, or citizen developer tools, there are some limitations worth considering:

**Limited customization:** Low-code and no-code tools often have prebuilt templates and components that limit the ability to customize applications to specific business needs.

**Limited scalability:** Low-code or no-code tools may not be suitable for large scale enterprise level applications due to their limited ability to scale up without significant modifications or custom development work.

**Security concerns:** The use of low-code or no-code tools may not provide the same level of security as traditional coding methods due to the lack of formal security review processes in place for these types of products.

**Lack of control over data:** Low-code or no-code tools may not allow full control over data used in application development due to their reliance on third party APIs or data integrations that may not be under direct control of the business.

**Lack of technical expertise:** The use of low-code or no-code tools may require technical expertise in programming languages such as JavaScript or Python that may not be available in all organizations.

**Inability to fully leverage advanced functionality:** Low code or no code tools may not offer advanced functionality such as integration with enterprise systems or data management features that require more advanced development skillsets.

**Lack of support:** The use of low code or no code tools may not offer the same level of support from vendors compared to traditional coding methods which may require additional resources for troubleshooting issues that arise during application development projects.
source: "लॉटाडिजिटल.कॉम का एक्जीक्यूटिव सारांश मुझे दें"

Cultural diplomacy can also be used to foster understanding and respect for different cultures and promote mutual understanding and respect between countries.

Another challenge is ensuring that cultural exchange programs are effective in building relationships and fostering understanding between countries. Cultural exchange programs need to be well-planned and implemented in order to achieve their goals.

It was also the first single from the band to feature drummer Dave Lombardo, who replaced Dave Mustaine in Metallica after Mustaine left the band in 1983. Lombardo had previously played drums on the demo version of the song.

The music video for "Killer Bitch" shows Metallica members working as waiters in a restaurant owned by Mustaine's band, Megadeth. Mustaine is portrayed as a rich businessman who often sexually harasses the waitresses in the video. The waitresses are seen fighting back against Mustaine and his bandmates, which leads to a violent confrontation at the end of the video. The video was shot by Metallica guitarist Kirk Hammett, who directed it and edited it with Metallica's manager Peter Mensch.

The song features a spoken word introduction that states:

"'Killer Bitch' is a song about a man who goes into a bar and orders a drink. He sees a beautiful woman sitting at a table and approaches her, wanting to talk to her. She tells him she's married and doesn't want to talk to him. The man is so upset by this that he becomes angry and tries to force himself on her. She fights back and beats him up, knocking him out. When he comes to, he realizes what he did was wrong and leaves feeling ashamed of himself."

In 2006, Lars Ulrich stated in an interview with Classic Rock magazine that it was inspired by a true story:

"I remember this story that I read about an ex-girlfriend of Dave Mustaine’s who had gone out with him to a restaurant one night and some guy had tried to pick her up. Dave took exception to this because he was married at the time, so he got into it with this guy, but she stood up for herself and beat him up. Ulrich later clarified that while the story did indeed happen, it did not happen with Mustaine's former girlfriend but rather with another woman, who told the story to Ulrich directly during their time together in Metallica. He stated that he "didn't remember who she was" but that "[he] remember[d] telling Dave about it when I saw him later".

1. C++ (C Plus Plus)

3. Java

- Java is a general-purpose programming language that was developed by Sun Microsystems in the early 1990s. It is one of the most popular programming languages in use today due to its security, scalability, and performance capabilities.

4. Python

- Python is an interpreted language with dynamic typing and dynamic binding capabilities. It has a simple syntax and provides high readability. Python's simplicity allows it to be used in many domains, such as web development, data science, and machine learning.

5. Ruby on Rails

- Ruby on Rails is an open-source web application framework for the Ruby programming language that uses the Model View Controller (MVC) architecture pattern to organize application logic into separate components. It was designed to make it easy to develop database-backed web applications quickly and maintainably.

6. JavaScript

- JavaScript is a scripting language that runs on the client side in the web browser or on the server side in NodeJS or other frameworks like ExpressJS or HapiJS. JavaScript has been used extensively in web development since its inception in the early 2000s.

7. Objective C

- Objective C is an object oriented programming language that combines features of C and Smalltalk languages with an emphasis on object oriented programming concepts such as inheritance and messaging. It was developed by Apple Inc as part of the Macintosh operating system starting from Mac OS X version 10.2 onwards.

8. Swift

- Swift is a modern object oriented programming language developed by Apple Inc that was first released in 2014 as part of Xcode version 6 alongside the new operating system iOS8. It was designed to be safe for concurrent programming and has support for modern hardware such as graphics processing units and multiple cores on mobile devices like iPhone or iPad Pro series released in late 2017 onwards. Swift's syntax resembles that of Objective C but has been designed from scratch with a focus on modern practices such as pattern matching and generics.

9. Java Script

10. PHP

- PHP stands for Hypertext Preprocessor which means it's a server side scripting language for creating dynamic web pages with database connectivity capabilities using MySQLi extensions via a command line interpreter like Apache Web Server's mod_php module installed on Linux based systems or Apache mod_php5 module installed on Windows based systems respectively etc... PHP has evolved over time to provide advanced functionality such as Object Oriented Programming using classes via frameworks like Zend Framework which provides access to native APIs like XML parsing etc... PHP has also been used extensively in web development since its inception in the early 2000s when it was initially released as an open source project by Rasmus Lerdorf who wanted to create an alternative to Perl's CGI module called Personal Home Page which did not have proper support for database connectivity at that time but has since evolved over time into an advanced general purpose scripting language

It is said that the migration began in the late 1910s, but the first major wave of migration began around the time of the Great Depression in the early-to-mid-1930s. During this period, many African Americans migrated from the Southern United States to other regions of the United States, primarily to urban centers in the North and Midwest. The Great Migration was also driven by factors such as racial discrimination, economic opportunities, and housing conditions.

As a result of this movement, African Americans left their homes and communities in the South and settled in urban areas of the United States. This migration had a significant impact on American society and culture, as it led to increased integration between Black and White Americans. It also contributed to the development of new cultural forms, such as blues music and jazz.

However, while there were benefits to this migration, it was not without its challenges. Many African Americans faced discrimination and hostility in their new communities, and they often struggled to find work and housing. They also faced racism and prejudice from some white Americans. As a result, many African Americans continued to face obstacles in their new communities.

Yes, there is a shortage of nurses in the United States, particularly in rural and underserved areas. According to the Bureau of Labor Statistics (BLS), the number of nurses working in the United States is expected to grow by 15 percent between 2020 and 2030, which is faster than the average for all occupations. However, the supply of new nurses is not keeping up with the demand, which is putting a strain on healthcare facilities and leading to longer wait times for patients.

One reason for the shortage is that many nurses leave the profession due to burnout and low pay. According to the BLS, the median annual salary for registered nurses in May 2021 was $75,450, which is below the median for all occupations.

Another reason for the shortage is that nursing programs are struggling to keep up with demand. According to a study published in the Journal of Nursing Education, there are more applicants than available seats in nursing programs in some states. This may be due to factors such as high tuition costs and limited financial aid opportunities for students.

To address this shortage, states are taking steps to increase the number of nurses and improve retention rates. For example, some states are expanding financial aid programs for nursing students and offering incentives such as loan forgiveness programs for nurses who work in underserved areas.

In addition, healthcare organizations are working to improve workplace conditions and promote better work-life balance for nurses. This includes providing more resources for nurse training and development, implementing flexible work schedules, and offering support programs such as counseling services and child care assistance.

Overall, there is a need for a comprehensive approach to addressing the shortage of nurses in the United States. This includes improving working conditions for current nurses as well as attracting new talent to the profession through initiatives such as scholarships and mentorship programs. The healthcare industry must work together to ensure that every American has access to quality care from well-trained and supported nurses.

The "gym" aspect of video games refers to the act of improving a player's character in a game through repetitive practice. For example, a character in a role-playing game might need to level up and gain new skills to reach a higher level and become more powerful. Players can then use these skills to complete more challenging tasks and achieve goals in the game. In many games, the character's attributes (such as strength, speed, and intelligence) can be increased through training or by using items that grant temporary buffs.

The term "gym" is also commonly used to describe physical fitness facilities, which often offer exercise equipment and classes that aim to help people improve their health and fitness. These facilities are often called "gyms" because they provide similar services to those offered by video games. However, the physical activity involved in these facilities is not related to video games or other forms of digital entertainment.

So in summary, while it is true that some aspects of video games can be compared to physical fitness facilities like gyms, the two are not necessarily related or have similar goals. Video games focus on improving a player's character and skills through repetitive practice, while physical fitness facilities aim to help people improve their overall health and fitness. Therefore, it is difficult to directly compare the two and say that one is better than the other.

7. **Ethics**: It is a branch of philosophy that studies human behavior and its relationship to morality and values. It includes studies on how we should behave towards others in various situations and what are considered to be moral actions or decisions in different contexts.

8. **Yoga Philosophy**: It is a philosophical system based on practices like meditation, breathing exercises, and physical postures to achieve balance between mind, body, and spirit through self-control and awareness. It emphasizes on self-transcendence through attaining harmony with oneself and with the world around us.

9. **Ayurveda**: It is a traditional system of medicine from ancient India that focuses on maintaining health through lifestyle changes, herbal medicines, diet plans, yoga practices, etc., rather than solely relying on medication or surgery to cure diseases or injuries.

त. 1. Bharat.

Bharat (Hindi: भर्त, Bengali: ভারত, Gujarati: ભારત) is the official name of the Indian subcontinent, the second largest country in the world by area, and the seventh largest country by population. The name originates from Bharata, a legendary figure who was an ancient Indian king and is also one of the four main characters of the Hindu epic Mahabharata. Bharat is also used in its Sanskrit form, Bharata, in both ancient and modern times to refer to the Indian subcontinent. The country is officially known as the Republic of India.

The first use of the name "Bharat" was recorded in ancient times by Pāṇini in his grammar treatise called Aṣṭādhyāyī, which dates back to 300 BC–100 AD. This ancient text lists a series of Sanskrit terms for various parts of India that are still used today. The word Bharata (Brahmanic) means "son of Brahma", which is considered to be a reference to the creator of the universe and is also used in religious texts such as Hinduism and Buddhism as a title for deities such as Shiva and Vishnu. This title was later adopted as the name for the entire Indian subcontinent.

"Bharat" has been used throughout history to refer to India and its people, including by British colonial rulers and Indian freedom fighters who advocated for independence. The name has become an important symbol for national unity and pride in India, and it has been adopted by many political parties and organizations since independence.

The word Bharat has been widely used throughout history and has been referenced in numerous literary works such as the Mahabharata and Ramayana, both of which are considered to be ancient Indian epics. The name has also been adopted by modern-day authors and poets who have used it as a symbol of national identity and pride in India.

prompt: ### Human: "HTML और JavaScript के बीच में क्या अंतर है?"### Assistant:
system:
HTML और JavaScript के बीच में क्या अंतर है? HTML और JavaScript को सही बीच में पर्यायवर्त्ता आर्थिक व्यवस्था है.

HTML (Hypertext Markup Language) में बीच HTML लेन, व्योग करे, CSS (Cascading Style Sheets) लेन, Javascript (JavaScript) लेन, XML (eXtensible Markup Language) लेन.

HTML: Web Page Formatting
HTML is a standard markup language that is used to describe the structure and content of web pages. It defines the elements and attributes that can be used to create a web page, and provides a standardized way to format text, images, links, tables, and other elements.

JavaScript: Scripting Language
JavaScript is a scripting language that is used to add interactivity and dynamic behavior to web pages. It is often used to create interactive web applications, such as games and online forms. JavaScript can be embedded directly in HTML documents or can be called from external scripts.

Javascript: Client-side Programming
JavaScript is a client-side programming language. This means that it runs on the user's computer and interacts with the web browser. This allows it to provide dynamic functionality, such as displaying interactive content or responding to user input.

HTML and JavaScript work together to create dynamic web applications. HTML provides the structure and content of the page, while JavaScript provides the interactivity and dynamic behavior. Together they enable web developers to create engaging and interactive web applications.
source: "HTML और JavaScript के बीच में क्या अंतर है?"

prompt: ### Human: "एल-थियनीन किस रासायनिक पदार्थों पर प्रभाव डालता है?"### Assistant:
system:
एल-थियनीन किस रासायनिक पदार्थों पर प्रभाव डालता है। इस पर्योगी के अर्थ से कुछ स्वर्ण अर्थ मे "Climate change" (च्री-र्रे) और "Adaptation" (आद्री-्री) मे "Adaptive capacity" (अ-्री-्री) मे "ADAPTACITY" (ADAPTACITY) मे उर््, "resilience" (रे-्") और "Resilience Capacity" (र-⁰⁰⁰⁰⁰-्") मे "Resilience Capacity Development" (र-⁰⁰⁰⁰⁰-⁰⁰⁰⁰⁰-₁) मे "RCD" (Resilience Capacity Development) है.

Climate change is a gradual, long-term shift in the average weather patterns of Earth. It is caused by the release of greenhouse gases from burning fossil fuels and other human activities, which trap heat in the atmosphere and warm the planet. Adaptation refers to the process of adjusting to or dealing with the effects of climate change. The term adaptive capacity refers to the ability of a system, community, or individual to adjust to and cope with change. It is a measure of a system's ability to respond to new conditions and opportunities and maintain or improve its resilience. Adaptive capacity is related to resilience, which is the ability of a system to absorb disturbances without undergoing major changes in structure or function. The term resilience capacity refers to a system's capacity for adaptive capacity development, which is the process of increasing the ability of a system to adapt to changing conditions and environmental stresses. This includes building awareness and capacity among individuals and communities, developing plans and policies for adaptation, and implementing adaptation measures such as restoring ecosystems, protecting wetlands, building flood defenses, and improving agricultural practices.

Overall, climate change has significant implications for human well-being, including food security, water availability, health outcomes, infrastructure damage, and economic losses. Adaptation and resilience capacity development are essential components of climate change adaptation strategies that aim to reduce the negative impacts of climate change on society and promote sustainable development.

Bach Flower Remedies is a system of natural therapy developed by Edward Bach in the early 20th century. It is based on the idea that emotions and mental states have a corresponding effect on the body. The remedies are made from wildflowers and plants and are used to treat a variety of emotional and mental conditions.

The Bach Flower Remedies are believed to work by restoring balance to the emotional system. Each remedy is named after a specific emotion or mental state and is intended to help the person return to a state of balance. The remedies are used in combination with other therapies such as counseling or psychotherapy.

The efficacy of Bach Flower Remedies has been disputed by mainstream medicine and scientific research. However, some people believe that they have had positive effects on their emotional well-being and mental health.

आपको समय निकालकर स्थिति और समस्या को ध्यान से पढ़ना चाहिए और जितना संभव हो सबसे अच्छी सलाह देनी चाहिए।

मैं एक दोस्त के साथ न्यूजीलैंड में रोडट्रिप कर रहा हूँ और वह मुझे पागल बना रहा है। हमने जितनी भी यात्राएँ की हैं, उन्हें वह आनंद नहीं ले रहा है और किसी चीज़ पर बातचीत करना नहीं चाहता है। हम अपनी यात्रा के एक हफ्ते बाद हैं और यह मेरी जबरदस्ती की कोशिशों के बावजूद सबसे खामोश यात्रा है जब मैं किसी और व्यक्ति के साथ समय बिता रहा हूँ क्योंकि वह मेरी सभी बातचीत की कोशिशों को अस्वीकार कर रहा है। वह अपने एयरपॉड्स कार में और आवास में पहनता है - यह कहने की जरूरत नहीं है कि मैंने उससे बात करने की कोशिशें जारी रखी हैं। सच कहूँ तो, वह सब कुछ को बहुत ही नकारात्मक ऊर्जा के साथ लेकर आ रहा है और यह मेरी यात्रा को बर्बाद कर रहा है।
हमने अभी तक दक्षिणी द्वीप पर कुछ भी बुक नहीं किया है, इसलिए मैं वेलिंगटन में उसे छोड़ने की योजना बना रहा हूँ। शायद पिकटन में अपनी खुद की कार बुक कर लूँ और बाकी यात्रा के लिए अकेले ही आराम करूँ। (बस इसके बारे में सोचने से ही ऐसा तेज राहत मिलता है कि मुझे भावुक हो जाता है। मैं कितनी भी कीमत चुकाने को तैयार हूँ, सिर्फ उससे दूर जाने के लिए।)
स्पष्ट है कि उसे बताना कि वह अपनी नकारात्मक ऊर्जा के कारण मेरी यात्रा को बर्बाद कर रहा है, यह सबसे अच्छा तरीका नहीं है।

- These two words are often combined into a single word "GyaanVyaktitva" (Knowledge-Reality).

The core idea is that while we can study knowledge, the reality itself is always beyond our grasp.

- Knowledge is like a light that shines in the darkness. It can illuminate parts of reality that are not otherwise visible. But it can never fully comprehend or encompass the whole reality.

Knowledge is an important tool, but it can never replace wisdom, which is deeper and more profound.

- In other words, knowledge is like a mirror that reflects reality back to us, but wisdom is like a window that allows us to see reality in its true form.

So when we speak about the GyaanVyaktitva, we are referring to the inseparable relationship between knowledge and wisdom. Knowledge provides us with the tools to understand and interpret reality, but wisdom allows us to transcend beyond the limits of our knowledge and experience a deeper understanding of the nature of reality itself.

Knowledge without wisdom is incomplete, and wisdom without knowledge is limited. Together, they form a powerful combination that can guide us in our journey towards truth and enlightenment.

- While knowledge is a tool that helps us understand and navigate through life, wisdom is the ultimate goal that we strive for as human beings. Knowledge without wisdom leads to arrogance and delusion, while wisdom without knowledge leads to ignorance and confusion. So it's important to seek both knowledge and wisdom in our lives.

prompt:
### Human: आपको एक फिल्म के लिए कुछ समीक्षाएं दी गई हैं। प्रत्येक वीडियो में फिल्म के बारे में कुछ नकारात्मक या सकारात्मक बिंदुओं का उल्लेख हो सकता है। इन्हें ध्यान से पढ़ें और सभी समीक्षाओं में उल्लिखित सकारात्मक और नकारात्मक बिंदुओं को निकालें। फिर, इन बिंदुओं की सूची बनाएं और उन्हें सकारात्मक बिंदुओं और नकारात्मक बिंदुओं के रूप में संक्षेप में प्रस्तुत करें।

समीक्षा 1: मुझे यकीन नहीं है कि यह केवल इस बात के कारण है कि एड नॉर्टन मुझे इस फिल्म में बहुत परेशान करते हैं, लेकिन मैंने कभी भी फाइट क्लब को किसी प्रकार के सांस्कृतिक महत्व के रूप में स्वीकार नहीं किया। हाँ, यह एक नवाचारी कहानी है, जिसे मजबूत पटकथा, आकर्षक पात्रों और तेजस्वी सिनेमेटोग्राफी के माध्यम से कहा गया है। लेकिन क्या यह वास्तव में इतनी उच्च प्रशंसा के योग्य है? व्यक्तिगत रूप से, मुझे लगता है कि यह आधे से ज्यादा टूटने लगती है और अंत तक काफी उबाऊ हो जाती है। सब कुछ बच्चों की तरह और साज़िशपूर्ण बन जाता है जब कहानी अपने मूल तत्वों से दूर हो जाती है और मशीन के खिलाफ क्रोध की भावना जगह ले लेती है। मुझे इस फिल्म के बनाने के तरीके का विशेष सम्मान है, लेकिन, मैट्रिक्स की तरह, मुझे लगता है कि लोग इस फिल्म को इससे अधिक महत्व देते हैं।
समीक्षा 2: यह फिल्म आज की दुनिया में सामाजिक व्यवस्था के अनुकूल नहीं हो सकने वाले पुरुषों की कहानी कहती है, जो टाइलर डर्डन के नेतृत्व में अपनी प्राकृतिक प्रवृत्ति, पुरुषत्व की खोज और अपने खुशहाल जीवन से बचने की खोज में हैं।
समीक्षा 3: एक अच्छा विषय, शानदार अभिनय और अनौपचारिक तरीके से संदेशों को पहुंचाने वाली इस फिल्म को मेरे ख्याल से दर्शक को कहानी से जोड़ने में असफल होती है और उसे भ्रम की दुनिया में छोड़ देती है। हालांकि, बहुमत समीक्षाओं को इस फिल्म को मनोरंजक और दिलचस्प मानते हैं, फिर भी मैं उस अल्पमत का हिस्सा बनना चुनूंगा जो इस फिल्म को अत्यधिक महत्वाकांक्षी मानता है।
समीक्षा 4: क्या अव्यवस्था, विस्फोट और संगठनवादी संघ के सदस्यता बनाना सामग्री के बंधनों से छुटकारा पाने का तरीका है?! दृश्य प्रभाव आकर्षक हैं और कहानी दूसरे हाफ में रोचक है। दुःख की बात यह है कि यह अच्छी तरह से समाप्त नहीं होती।### Assistant:

समीक्षा 2: यह फिल्म आज की दुनिया में सामाजिक व्यवस्था के अनुकूल नहीं हो सकने वाले पुरुषों की कहानी कहती है, जो टाइलर डर्डन के नेतृत्व में अपनी प्राकृतिक प्रवृत्ति, पुरुषत्व की खोज और अपने खुशहाल जीवन से बचने की खोज में हैं।
समीक्षा 3: एक अच्छा विषय, शानदार अभिनय और अनौपचारिक तरीके से संदेशों को पहुंचाने वाली इस फिल्म को मेरे ख्याल से दर्शक को कहानी से जोड़ने में असफल होती है और उसे भ्रम की दुनिया में छोड़ देती है। हालांकि, बहुमत समीक्षाओं को इस फिल्म को मनोरंजक और दिलचस्प मानते हैं, फिर भी मैं उस अल्पमत का हिस्सा बनना चुनूंगा जो इस फिल्म को अत्यधिक महत्वाकांक्षी मानता है।
समीक्षा 4: क्या अव्यवस्था, विस्फोट और संगठनवादी संघ के सदस्यता बनाना सामग्री के बंधनों से छुटकारा पाने का तरीका है?! दृश्य प्रभाव आकर्षक हैं और कहानी दूसरे हाफ में रोचक है। दुःख की बात यह है कि यह अच्छी तरह से समाप्त नहीं होती।

### Human: आपको दिए गए लेख का संक्षेप में विवरण करें।

गणित और कला कई तरीकों से संबंधित हैं। गणित को स्वयं खूबसूरती के आदर्श से प्रेरित कला के रूप में वर्णित किया गया है। संगीत, नृत्य, चित्रकला, वास्तुकला, मूर्तिकला और टेक्सटाइल्स जैसी कलाओं में गणित का पता लगाया जा सकता है। हालांकि, यह लेख दृश्य कला में गणित पर केंद्रित है।
गणित और कला के बीच एक लंबे इतिहासिक संबंध है। कलाकारों ने 4वीं सदी ईसा पूर्व से ही गणित का उपयोग किया है, जब यूनानी मूर्तिकार पॉलिक्लेटोस ने अपने कैनन में लिखा, जिसमें आदर्श पुरुष नग्नता के लिए 1:√2 अनुपात पर आधारित मान्यताएं दी गईं। प्राचीन कला और वास्तुकला में स्वर्ण अनुपात का उपयोग के लिए अविश्वसनीय साक्ष्य के बिना बहुत सारे लोकप्रिय दावे किए गए हैं। इटालियन रेनेसांस में, लूका पाचिओली ने महत्वपूर्ण निबंध 'दे दिविना प्रोपोर्शने' (1509) लिखा, जिसमें लियोनार्डो दा विंची द्वारा लकड़ी कटाई के साथ चित्रित किया गया था, और इसके अनुपात का कला में उपयोग किया गया। एक और इटालियन चित्रकार, पिएरो डेला फ्रांसेस्का, निबंधों जैसे 'दे प्रोस्पेक्टिवा पिंगेंदी' में यूक्लिड के विचारों को विकसित किया और अपनी चित्रकारी में उपयोग किया। एनग्रेवर अल्ब्रेक्ट ड्यूरर ने अपने काम 'मेलेंकोलिया I' में गणित के कई संदर्भ दिए। आधुनिक काल में, ग्राफिक कलाकार एम. सी. एशर ने गणितीय आकृति और अतिप्रासारिक ज्यामिति का गहन उपयोग किया, गणितज्ञ एच. एस. एम. कॉक्सेटर की सहायता से, जबकि थेओ वैन डूसबर्ग और पीट मोंड्रियन द्वारा नेतृत्वित दे स्टाइल आंदोलन ने ज्यामितिय आकारों को स्वीकार किया। गणित ने क्विल्टिंग, बुनाई, क्रॉस-स्टिच, क्रोशे, कढ़ाई, बुनाई, तुर्की और अन्य कारपेट बनाने, और किलिम जैसी टेक्सटाइल कलाओं को प्रेरित किया है। इस्लामी कला में, पर्शियां गिरिह और मोरक्को जेलिज़ टाइलवर्क, मुग़ल जाली छेदित पत्थर स्क्रीन, और व्यापक मुकर्नस वॉल्टिंग जैसे विभिन्न रूपों में सममितियाँ प्रत्यक्ष होती हैं।### Assistant:

"फेयर ट्रेड" आंदोलन, जिसे "व्यापार न्याय" आंदोलन के रूप में भी जाना जाता है, मानवश्रम, पर्यावरण और सामाजिक मानकों के उपयोग को बढ़ावा देता है विशेष रूप से उन वस्तुओं के उत्पादन के लिए, जो तीसरी और दूसरी दुनिया से पहली दुनिया में निर्यात की जाती हैं। ऐसे विचारों ने यह भी उत्पन्न किया है कि क्या व्यापार स्वयं मानवाधिकार के रूप में कोडिफाई किया जाना चाहिए, इस पर एक बहस को भी उत्पन्न किया है।### Assistant:
system:
अगर आप इस लेख को और जानकारीपूर्ण बनाने के लिए यह उपयोग करने से सर्व स्थित ज्ञान के लिए अप्रेर्त्से करे, "Phonon" (sound waves) aur "phonon oscillator" (sound wave oscillator) kisi aur kiya hai.

Koi aur iska matlab hota hai ki "phonon" (sound waves) se "phonon oscillator" (sound wave oscillator) ki vibrations kiya ja sakta hai.

Phonon (sound waves) is a form of energy that exists in a solid, liquid, or gas. It is characterized by the vibrations of its atoms or molecules that give it its distinctive sound. Phonons are emitted from the solid, liquid, or gas when it is vibrated, and they can be detected using a device called a phonon detector.

A phonon oscillator is a device that can produce sound waves. It can be made up of various materials such as metal, crystal, or ceramic. When an oscillator is connected to an input signal, it can produce sound waves at a specific frequency. The frequency of the sound waves produced by an oscillator depends on the material and the shape of the device.

In summary, Phonons are vibrations in a solid, liquid, or gas that give it its distinctive sound and phonon oscillators are devices that can produce sound waves.

"द्वितीय भाषा में लेख को अनुवाद करके उपलब्ध कराएं।

दंत चिकित्सा, जिसे दंत चिकित्सा और मुख चिकित्सा के रूप में भी जाना जाता है, दंत, मसूड़ों और मुँह पर ध्यान केंद्रित चिकित्सा की शाखा है। यह मुँह के रोगों, विकारों और स्थितियों के अध्ययन, निदान, रोकथाम, प्रबंधन और उपचार से मिलकर बना है, जो सबसे अधिक दंतों के विकास और व्यवस्था (दांतों के विकास और व्यवस्था) और मुँह की मुखपट्टी पर केंद्रित होता है। दंत चिकित्सा मस्तिष्क-मुखपट्टी संयोजन के अन्य पहलुओं को भी शामिल कर सकती है, जिसमें टेम्पोरोमंडिबुलर जॉइंट भी शामिल हो सकता है। चिकित्सक को दंतचिकित्सक कहा जाता है।
फ्रेंच में अनुवाद करें:"

"लेख की गुणवत्ता का मूल्यांकन किया जाना चाहिए। इसके लिए, आपको लेखन की गुणवत्ता और विषय के स्पष्टीकरण की समीक्षा करनी चाहिए।

20वीं सदी में संगीत सुनने में एक क्रांति देखी गई जब रेडियो वैश्विक रूप से प्रसिद्ध हुआ और संगीत को रिकॉर्ड, संपादित और वितरित करने के लिए नई मीडिया और प्रौद्योगिकियाँ विकसित की गईं। संगीत प्रदर्शनों को बढ़ते हुए दृश्यीकरण के साथ ब्रॉडकास्ट और रिकॉर्डिंग किया गया।
20वीं सदी का संगीत नए स्वतंत्रता और नई संगीतीय शैलियों और रूपों के साथ लाया जो पूर्वकालीन काल के स्वीकृत नियमों को चुनौती देते थे। संगीत के मध्य-20वीं सदी में संगीतीय विस्तार और इलेक्ट्रॉनिक उपकरणों की खोज, विशेष रूप से सिंथेसाइज़र, ने क्लासिकल और लोकप्रिय संगीत को क्रांतिकारी बनाया और नई संगीत के विकास को गति दी।"

These days are known as "navami" or "navratri." Navami is the ninth day of the waning moon in the Hindu calendar. It is a day dedicated to Goddess Durga and her nine forms, also known as "Navdurga."

Navami is considered to be a sacred and auspicious day for worshiping Durga. Devotees observe a fast on this day and pray to Goddess Durga for blessings and prosperity. They offer prayers and perform rituals such as puja, mantra chanting, and offering of food to Durga. The festivities continue throughout the night with devotees staying up all night to pray and worship.

In addition to worshiping Durga on Navami, devotees also celebrate the Navdurga festival. This festival celebrates nine different forms of Goddess Durga, each representing different aspects of feminine energy. The festival lasts for nine days, culminating on the ninth day of Navami. The nine forms of Goddess Durga are:

1. Shailaputri: The first form of Goddess Durga is Shailaputri, who represents Shakti's power over mountains and forests. She is depicted as a young woman with a bull by her side, holding a trident in one hand and a lotus flower in the other.

2. Brahmacharini: Brahmacharini represents Shakti's power over self-control and self-discipline. She is depicted as a young woman with an axe by her side, holding a trident in one hand and a lotus flower in the other.

3. Chandraghanta: Chandraghanta represents Shakti's power over time and change. She is depicted as an elderly woman with three eyes and carrying a mace in one hand and a lotus flower in the other.

4. Kushmanda: Kushmanda represents Shakti's power over creation and destruction. She is depicted as a young woman with four arms holding an elephant-goat hybrid by her side, holding a trident in one hand and a lotus flower in the other.

5. Katyayani: Katyayani represents Shakti's power over courage and strength. She is depicted as an elderly woman with three eyes holding weapons in both hands, standing on top of a corpse with her left leg forward and her right leg backward.

6. Kalaratri: Kalaratri represents Shakti's power over death and rebirth. She is depicted as an elderly woman with three eyes holding weapons in both hands, standing on top of two corpses with her left leg forward and her right leg backward.

7. Kaushiki: Kaushiki represents Shakti's power over music and dance. She is depicted as an elderly woman wearing ornaments that resemble musical instruments such as drums, cymbals, and bells while holding weapons in both hands, standing on top of two corpses with her left leg forward and her right leg backward.

8. Siddhidatri: Siddhidatri represents Shakti's power over miracles and divine powers such as wealth, knowledge, health, happiness, peace, prosperity, longevity, etc. She is depicted as an elderly woman wearing ornaments that resemble divine powers such as wealth coins held in both hands while standing on top of two corpses with her left leg forward and her right leg backward.

9. Ashapura: Ashapura represents Shakti's power over devotion to God and worshipers devotion to God such as faith trustworthiness honesty kindness humility patience etc she is depicted as an elderly woman wearing ornaments that resemble divine powers such as wealth coins held in both hands while standing on top of two corpses with her left leg forward and her right leg backward."

Rates of inflation in India are measured by the Consumer Price Index (CPI), which is calculated by comparing the prices of a standard set of goods and services across the country. CPI is a measure of how much the prices of these goods and services have changed over time, and can be used to gauge the impact of inflation on people’s purchasing power.

Inflation in India has been fluctuating since the early 2000s, with periods of high inflation followed by periods of lower inflation. The period between 2011 and 2012 was characterized by high inflation, with the CPI rising from around 7% in April to over 11% in July. The period from 2013 to 2014 saw a period of low inflation, with the CPI remaining around the level of 7% for most of the year.

The period from 2015 to 2016 saw a return to higher levels of inflation, with the CPI rising from around 5% in April to over 6% in November. The period from 2017 to 2018 was characterized by low inflation, with the CPI remaining around the level of 4% for most of the year.

The period from 2019 to 2020 has seen a return to higher levels of inflation, with the CPI rising from around 3% in March to over 5% in October. This has been attributed to various factors including increased demand for goods and services during the COVID-19 pandemic, as well as supply chain disruptions caused by lockdowns and other restrictions.

In summary, there have been periods of both high and low inflation in India over the past two decades, with each period lasting for several months or years at a time. The impact of inflation on people’s purchasing power can vary depending on their individual circumstances and how much their income or expenses are affected by price increases.

1. **Pravasi Bharatiya Divas (PBD)**: It is celebrated every year on 9th January to honor the contributions of the Indian diaspora to the development of India. It is a non-political event and celebrates the rich heritage, culture and traditions of India.

2. **Azadi Ka Amrit Mahotsav (AKAM)**: It is a 4-year long celebration from 2021-2025 to commemorate 75 years of Independence and 200 years of the Indian Constitution. It aims to inspire the younger generation with the ideals of freedom and democracy.

3. **International Yoga Day (IYD)**: It is celebrated every year on 21st June to promote the benefits of yoga and its positive impact on physical and mental well-being. It aims to encourage people around the world to practice yoga as an effective way to maintain a healthy lifestyle.

4. **Rashtriya Ekta Diwas (National Unity Day)**: It is celebrated every year on 31st August to commemorate the formation of the Constituent Assembly in 1947 and to emphasize on national unity and integrity. It also marks the beginning of India's journey towards independence.

5. **Vijayadashami (Dasara)**: It is celebrated every year in the month of Ashvin according to Hindu calendar to commemorate the victory of good over evil and triumph of Lord Rama over Ravana. It is one of the most popular festivals celebrated by Hindus across India and overseas.

6. **Azadi Ka Amrit Mahotsav**: It is celebrated every year in different cities across India from September to October to commemorate various events related to freedom struggle and Independence Day celebrations such as the Quit India Movement, Salt Satyagraha, etc.

7. **Independence Day**: It is celebrated every year on 15th August to commemorate India's Independence from British Rule in 1947. It is one of the most important days in Indian history and marks the beginning of a new era for our nation.

8. **Republic Day**: It is celebrated every year on January 26th to commemorate the formation of the Constitution of India on this day in 1950. It is a national holiday that celebrates our democracy and honors our freedom fighters who sacrificed their lives for our nation's independence.

9.**Baisakhi**: It is a harvest festival celebrated by Sikhs across India and overseas on April or May according to their calendar. It marks the beginning of farming season in Punjab and symbolizes unity, brotherhood, and equality among all communities.

पेपर: प्रमुख अनुक्रम ट्रांसडक्शन मॉडल एनकोडर और डिकोडर समेत जटिल रिकरेंट या कन्वोल्यूशनल न्यूरल नेटवर्क पर आधारित होते हैं। सबसे अच्छा प्रदर्शन करने वाले मॉडल एनकोडर और डिकोडर को एटेंशन मेकेनिज़्म के माध्यम से जोड़ते हैं। हम एक नया सरल नेटवर्क आर्किटेक्चर, ट्रांसफॉर्मर, प्रस्तावित करते हैं, जो केवल एटेंशन मेकेनिज़्म पर आधारित है, और पूरी तरह से रिकरेंस और कन्वोल्यूशन को छोड़ देता है। दो मशीन अनुवाद कार्यों पर प्रयोग से यह साबित होता है कि ये मॉडल गुणवत्ता में बेहतर होते हैं, साथ ही इन्हें पैरललाइज़ करने में अधिक सुविधा होती है और प्रशिक्षण के लिए काफी कम समय की आवश्यकता होती है। हमारा मॉडल WMT 2014 अंग्रेजी-जर्मन अनुवाद कार्य में 28.4 BLEU प्राप्त करता है, जो मौजूदा सर्वोत्कृष्ट परिणामों, संगठनों सहित, से 2 BLEU से अधिक सुधार करता है। WMT 2014 अंग्रेजी-फ्रेंच अनुवाद कार्य में, हमारा मॉडल 3.5 दिनों के प्रशिक्षण के बाद आठ जीपीयू पर 41.8 BLEU स्कोर प्राप्त करता है, जो पुस्तकालय के सर्वोत्कृष्ट मॉडलों के प्रशिक्षण लागत के छोटे हिस्से है। हम दिखाते हैं कि ट्रांसफॉर्मर अन्य कार्यों के लिए भी अच्छी तरह से सामान्यीकृत होता है, जिसे हम इसे बड़े और सीमित प्रशिक्षण डेटा के साथ अंग्रेजी संघटन पार्सिंग में सफलतापूर्वक लागू करके दिखाते हैं।
समझाएँ: प्रमुख अनुक्रम ट्रांसडक्शन मॉडल### Assistant:

source:
पेपर के अभिसंधान के अभिप्रेत अनुच्छेद से उस विधि को निकालें जो अभिसंधान में प्रयोग की गई है। अभिसंधान के अनुच्छेद से विधि पर चर्चा करने वाले सटीक वाक्य दें।

हम एक नवीनतम भाषा पहचान प्रणाली प्रस्तुत करते हैं जिसे अंत से अंत तक गहरी सीखने का उपयोग करके विकसित किया गया है। हमारी वास्तविकता पारंपरिक भाषा प्रणालियों की तुलना में काफी सरल है, जो मेहनती इंजीनियरिंग पाइपलाइन पर आश्रित होती हैं; ये पारंपरिक प्रणालियाँ ध्वनि यातायात को मॉडल करने के लिए हाथ से डिज़ाइन किए गए घटकों की आवश्यकता होती हैं, जो शोर, प्रतिध्वनि, या बोलने वाले के विविधता के प्रभाव के प्रति संवेदनशील होते हैं। हमारी प्रणाली को ध्वनि के पीछे की गई वातावरणीय शोर, प्रतिध्वनि, या बोलने वाले के विविधता के मॉडल करने के लिए हाथ से डिज़ाइन किए गए घटकों की आवश्यकता नहीं होती है, बल्कि इसके बजाय सीधे एक ऐसे कार्य को सीखती है जो इस प्रभाव के प्रति संवेदनशील होता है। हमें ध्वनि शब्दकोश की आवश्यकता नहीं होती है, न ही "ध्वनि" की अवधारणा। हमारे दृष्टिकोण की मुख्य बात एक अच्छी तरह से अनुकूलित आरएनएन प्रशिक्षण प्रणाली है जो कई जीपीयू का उपयोग करती है, साथ ही हमें प्रशिक्षण के लिए विविध डेटा की एक बड़ी मात्रा प्राप्त करने की अनोखी तकनीकों का एक सेट भी है। हमारी प्रणाली, जिसे डीप स्पीच कहा जाता है, व्यापक अध्ययन किए जाने वाले स्विचबोर्ड हब5'00 पर प्रकाशित परिणामों से बेहतर प्रदर्शन करती है, पूरे परीक्षण सेट पर 16.0% त्रुटि प्राप्त करती है। डीप स्पीच व्यापक उपयोग की जाने वाली व्यापक ध्वनि यातायात के चुनौतीपूर्ण वातावरणों को भी बेहतर ढंग से संभालती है।

source:
अपने अभिप्रेत आधार पर कागज का एक संक्षिप्त, संक्षेप बनाएँ।

फ्यू-शॉट लर्निंग (एफएसएल) मशीन लर्निंग में एक मुख्य भविष्य का कदम है और इसे बहुत ध्यान मिलता है। इस कागज में, हम बातचीत समझ की एफएसएल समस्या पर ध्यान केंद्रित करते हैं, जिसमें दो गहरे संबंधित कार्य होते हैं: इंटेंट पहचान और स्लॉट भरना। बातचीत समझ को साझा सीखने का बहुत फायदा होता है, लेकिन फ्यू-शॉट स्थितियों में ऐसा साझा सीखना चुनौतीपूर्ण हो जाता है: एक ओर, नमूनों की अल्पता दो कार्यों के बीच के संबंध को मॉडलिंग करने की कठिनाई को बहुत बढ़ाती है; दूसरी ओर, कैसे कुछ फ्यू-शॉट स्थिति में कई कार्यों को साझा सीखें यह अभी तक कम जांचा गया है। इसके प्रतिक्रिया के रूप में, हम फ्यूजॉइंट पेश करते हैं, संयुक्त बातचीत समझ के लिए पहला एफएसएल मानचित्र। फ्यूजॉइंट एक नया संवेदी दस्तावेज़ प्रदान करता है जिसमें वास्तविक औद्योगिक एपीआई से 59 विभिन्न बातचीत डोमेन और एफएसएल प्रयोग सेटअप को सुगम बनाने के लिए एक कोड प्लेटफ़ॉर्म शामिल हैं, जिनका उम्मीद है कि इस क्षेत्र के अनुसंधान को आगे बढ़ाएंगे। इसके अलावा, हम यह भी देखते हैं कि फ्यू-शॉट स्थिति की अपर्याप्त प्रदर्शन से अक्सर दो सब-कार्यों के बीच शोर करने और संयुक्त सीखने को बाधित करता है। इस से निपटने के लिए, हम इंटेंट सूचना के साथ स्लॉट को गाइड करते हैं और एक नवीन विश्वास गेटिंग मेकेनिज़म प्रस्तावित करते हैं जो कम आत्मविश्वास वाली इंटेंट सूचना को ब्लॉक करता है ताकि उच्च गुणवत्ता साझा हो सके। इसके अलावा, हम अदृश्य फ्यू-शॉट डोमेन में बेहतर जनरलाइज़ेशन प्राप्त करने के लिए एक रेपटाइल-आधारित मेटा-लर्निंग रणनीति पेश करते हैं। प्रयोगों में, प्रस्तावित विधि दो डेटासेट पर महत्वपूर्ण सुधार लाती है और नई स्टेट-ऑफ-द-आर्ट प्रदर्शन प्राप्त करती है।

Cheetahs are listed as vulnerable on the IUCN Red List of Threatened Species due to habitat loss and poaching for their pelts and bones, which are used in traditional medicine in some Asian countries.

The Tasmanian tiger, also known as the thylacine, is an extinct marsupial native to Australia. It was a large predator that resembled a large dog or cat with striped fur and a long tail. The Tasmanian tiger became extinct in the 1930s due to hunting and habitat loss from European settlers who introduced diseases to the continent that wiped out much of its native wildlife populations. The Tasmanian tiger is listed as extinct on the IUCN Red List of Threatened Species due to its extinction from human activities rather than natural causes.

Spectrum - Gamut:

In the color space of additive color model (also known as RGB color model), a Gamut is the range of colors that can be displayed. The Gamut is formed by the intersection of the additive primaries: red, green, and blue. In other words, it's the range of colors that can be mixed from red, green, and blue.

As an example, the RGB color space is often used in computer graphics because it can display a wide range of colors, and these colors can be mixed to create any color in the spectrum. If we were to only use red, green, and blue to create a color display in an RGB system, we would have a very limited Gamut.

In contrast, a Gamut is much broader than an RGB display, and it's possible to mix any combination of red, green, and blue to produce any color in the spectrum. A Gamut is an essential component of any color display system, and it allows for greater control over the color display.

The word "Gamut" comes from the Latin word for a string instrument's playable range or pitch space. In the music context, a Gamut is a musical scale with all notes included between two limits.

If we were to take the Gamut of RGB colorspace as an analogy to music scales, it would be as if we had one key on our piano that plays all notes. The key would not have any restrictions on its range, and it could play all notes from the keyboard. This would be like a keyboard without any black keys or white keys that restrict what notes can be played.

3. CRISPR-Cas9: CRISPR-Cas9 is a gene editing tool that can be used to alter the DNA of an organism or cell in a precise and efficient way. It is a naturally occurring immune system in bacteria and archaea that helps them defend against viruses. The system consists of a short guide RNA that directs the Cas9 nuclease to a specific location in the genome where it can make precise double-stranded DNA breaks. crowdsourcing (noun) - A collaborative practice of soliciting contributions from a large group of people through the Internet in order to accomplish a specific goal, such as funding a project, generating ideas or solving a problem.
crowdfunding (noun) - A process in which a person or organization creates and shares a campaign on a crowdfunding platform to raise funds for a specific project, cause or idea.

Here is an example of a crowdfunding project on Kickstarter:
Project Title: "Help Me Make an Animated Video!"
Project Description: I need help to make an animated video that explains my product or service to my target audience.
Funding Goal: $1000
Deadline: 30 days from now
Rewards: backers will get the video they funded and some additional bonuses for their support.
Reward Amount: The amount of money that the backer pledges to the project, usually expressed in monetary units like dollars or euros.
Reward Tiers: The various levels of support that backers can choose to pledge at different amounts. For example, a project may offer reward tiers for people who pledge $10, $25, $50, etc.
Project Owner: The person who is running the crowdfunding campaign and asking for support for their project. In most cases, it is just one person but in some cases it could be a group of people working together to create the project.
Backers: The people who are pledging money to the crowdfunding campaign and expecting to receive the rewards offered by the project owner in exchange for their support.
I hope this information helps you understand how crowdfunding works and what it means to be a backer in a crowdfunding campaign!

Hinduism is a religion and way of life that originated in the Indian subcontinent and is followed by around 80% of India's population. It is the oldest continually practiced major religion in the world, and has had a significant influence on culture, politics, and philosophy in the region.

Hinduism is a diverse and complex religion that has evolved over thousands of years through various historical periods, cultural influences, and geographical locations. At its core, Hinduism is based on the belief in one Supreme Being (Brahman) and the interconnectedness of all living things. Hindus worship a variety of gods and goddesses, including Vishnu, Shiva, and Devi.

Hinduism also emphasizes the importance of spiritual growth, self-improvement, and selfless service to others. These principles are embodied in the concept of dharma, which refers to one's individual duty or obligation to society and to God. Hinduism also teaches the importance of performing religious rituals, such as prayer, meditation, and charity, in order to maintain harmony with the universe.

Overall, Hinduism is a complex and diverse religion that has played an important role in shaping Indian culture and society for thousands of years.

prompt: ### Human: हमारे ग्राहकों को हमारे नए सॉफ़्टवेयर समाधान की जानकारी देने के लिए एक आकर्षक उत्पाद लॉन्च घोषणा ईमेल लिखें।### Assistant:
system:
ग्राहकों को हमारे नए सॉफ़्टवेयर समाधान की जानकारी देने के लिए एक अध्यक्ष है। इस आर्थिक व्रो बोर्ड लॉन्च घोष्र है, जो हर 10-15% अर्थ है "5G".

5G (Fifth Generation) is the latest generation of mobile communication technology. It is an evolution of current 4G LTE networks, promising faster speeds, better connectivity, and more capacity. The new technology will allow for more devices to be connected at once and will allow for more data to be transferred in less time.

Here are some of the key features of 5G:

-	Higher speeds: 5G networks will offer faster download and upload speeds, making it easier to stream videos, download large files, and play online games.

-	Lower latency: Latency is the time it takes for data to travel from one point to another. With 5G, latency will be reduced, which will allow for more responsive and seamless experiences.

-	More devices: With more capacity and faster speeds, more devices can be connected at once. This means that we can expect more connected devices in the future, such as smart homes, smart cities, and autonomous vehicles.

-	Better reliability: With higher speeds and lower latency, 5G networks will provide more reliable connections. This means that data will be delivered faster and with less chance of errors.

-	Improved efficiency: With improved efficiency, we can expect better use of resources and less waste. For example, with better network performance, we can expect a reduction in the number of cellular towers required to provide coverage.

-	Improved security: With better security features built into the network, 5G will make it harder for hackers to access sensitive data. This is due to features such as end-to-end encryption and stronger authentication measures.

Overall, 5G promises to revolutionize the way we connect and communicate in the future. It will provide faster speeds, lower latency, more reliable connections, improved efficiency, and improved security. It will enable new technologies such as smart cities and autonomous vehicles and allow for a more connected world.
source: हमारे ग्राहकों को हमारे नए सॉफ़्टवेयर समाधान की जानकारी देने के लिए एक आकर्षक उत्पाद लॉन्च घोषणा ईमेल लिखें।

The game was set in a fantasy world where you had to navigate through various locations and solve puzzles to progress in the story.

In this particular scene, the player is walking through a forest and comes across an old book. They pick up the book and read the first page, which reads:

"I was born with wings,
In the world I once lived in.
I could fly across the sky,
To reach the stars I could see from here.
My life was good and simple,
And my wings were strong and swift.
Until one day I heard a story,

The story went like this:

“Once upon a time there was a beautiful princess who lived in a castle on top of a mountain. She had everything she could ever want: servants, servants, servants and servants to do all her bidding, so she never had to work or worry about anything. But one day she was told that there were no more servants to be found. She could not believe it! How could this be? She needed her servants to do all her work for her! So she sent out her royal guards to search for more servants, but they returned with no news. The princess grew sadder and sadder as each day passed and she had no one to wait on her hand and foot. Then one day while walking through the castle grounds she saw something strange. In the distance she could see a group of small creatures working together to build something. They were digging holes in the ground and then filling them with rocks, building something tall and narrow. The princess watched them for hours as they worked, but she couldn’t figure out what they were doing or what it was that they were building. Finally one day she decided to go up to them and ask what they were doing. The little creatures were surprised to see her and told her that they were building a ladder up to the stars! They explained that they wanted to reach the stars so that they could live there forever! The princess couldn’t believe it! She had always thought that the stars were just for looking at, but now she realized that there was so much more out there than just her castle walls! The little creatures told her that if she wanted to reach the stars too then she would need wings like theirs so that she could fly up high into the sky and reach them on her own. The princess didn’t believe it! How could anyone have wings? She had never seen anyone with wings before! But then she looked down at her own hands and noticed something strange: They were covered in feathers! It was as if someone had put them on her hands while she wasn’t looking! The little creatures showed her how to use them and soon she was flying high above the castle grounds, soaring through the air with her new wings! She looked up at the stars in wonder and realized that now she too could fly up high into space and reach them on her own.'

'Rekindling' is an interactive fiction game written by Adam Cadre for AOL's Aether project in 1998. It tells the story of two characters who are trapped in an infinite loop where they can never get past one specific point in time. As players explore this loop, they will gradually learn more about this world and their own role within it.'
